intro: Turraea kimbozensis, commonly known as the Congo turraea, is a flowering plant native to central and western Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
